div.p:
I am much obliged to you for your kind letter of the 11th ult.° My Georgian studies have not by any means progressed so far as you seem to think. In 1887 I wrote a little book of travel called „The Kingdom of Georgia“
John Oliver Wardrop, The Kingdom of Georgia: travel in a land of women, wine and song, London: Sampson, Low, Marston, Searle & Rivington, 1888.
, which is now out of print, but I have given orders that a bound copy of the rough proofs should be sent to you from England, if this can be found. Last year I published in Boston a translation of Professor Tsagareli’s
Catalogue of the Georgian MSS. in Jerusalem: I send you a copy.
A. A. Tsagareli / John Oliver Wardrop, Professor Tsagareli’s Catalogue of the Georgian Manuscripts in the Monastery of the Holy Cross at Jerusalem, Sankt Petersburg, 1889 (Svyedyeniya o pamyatnikakh Gruzinskoi Pismennosti) [Erstveröffentlichung in Journal of Biblical Literature, 12]. I also published a translation of Saba Orbeliani’s „Book of Wisdom and Lies“ (წიგნი სიბრძნე სიცრუისა), published in an editon de luxe by Mr. William Morris, but I hear that it is exhausted.
The book of wisdom and lies / [Verf.:] Sulkhan - Saba Orbeliani. Transl. by Oliver Wardrop, Hammersmith: Kelmscott Press, London: Bernard Quaritch, (1894).
My sister has translated a collection of Georgian „Folk Tales“ (publ. d by David Nutt)
Marjory Wardrop (transl.), Georgian folk tales, London: D. Nutt, 1894.
, and she is now seeking to print a verse translation of Dchavdchavadze’s „Hermit“
The Hermit: a legend, by Ilia Chavchavadze; translated from the Georgian, by Marjory Wardrop, London: Bernard Quaritch, 1895.
( განდეგილი) & other poems.

My friend C. Dodashvili printed in მანდემილი an intresting grammatical sketchNicht identifiziert; möglicherweise ein Verwandter oder Nachfahr von Salomon Dodashvili (1805-1836), georgischer Philosoph, Lehrer, Journalist und Belletrist. which I had completely translated. Unfortunately, my ms. seems to have been lost or stolen during my journey to the Crimea. I should recommend you to write to Dodashvili
for information about grammatical questions. His address is:
Koncmaнmuнy Дeoдaшbuam.Es ist keine Korrespondenz mit Schuchardt erhalten.

It is difficult to get the older books you mention, but if you apply to the Tpybuнckoe Издameлъckoe Тobapщecmbo in Tiflis I think they could send you the grammars of CliphianiLesart unsicher; Autor nicht nachgewiesen., AntoniZu den kaum zu verifizierenden Literaturangaben vgl. Schuchardt, „Kharthwelische Sprachwissenschaft I“, Wiener Zeitschrift für die Kunde des Morgenlandes 10, 1896, 115-128 ., Zordania
F. Žordania, Kʿartʿuli grammatika (etimologia da sintakʿsi), Tpilisi (Tiflis): Ḥeladze, 1889.
and the 1886 edition of Chubinov’s dictionary (Georgian-Russian & Russ. Georgian)
Davit‘ Č'ubinašvil, K̕art̕ul-rusuli lek̕sikoni, Sanktpeterburg: Tipogr. Imperatorskoj Akademīi Naukʺ, 1887.
which is much better than the 1840 bilingual lexicon.
David Čubinov, Gruzinsko-russko-francuzskij slovar, Sankt-Peterburg: Tip. Imp. Akad. Nauk, 1840.
Though is has still many faults.

Tsagareli
Alexander Tsagareli (1844-1929), Prof. der Linguistik in St. Petersburg und Mitbegründer der staatl. Univ. in Tiflis. was here with us in Kertch about a fortnight ago, and stayed three days, on his way to Kislovodsk.Kislowodsk ist eine Stadt mit 128.553 Einwohnern in der Region Stawropol in Russland. Sie liegt im nördlichen Kaukasus rund 234 Kilometer von der Regionshauptstadt Stawropol (wikipedia)
He, like all his Countrymen, rejoices to see that you are seriously occupying yourself with the language.

The lack of intelligible grammars and philological works on Georgian is the chief cause why so little is known of the language and literature in Europe. The beginner has to depend almost entirely on Brosset, who is nearly worthless. Marie Ivanovich Brosset (1802-1880), franz. Linguist u. Orientalist, der auch Arbeiten zum Georgischen und Armenischen veröffentlichte.

closer.salute: I look forward with pleasure to the receipt of your works
